newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Dispute halts work at Kelani.
newsitem.headline: Dispute halts work at Kelani.

text.p: Demands for payment of a cost of living allowance has led to a work stoppage at Kelani Tyre Ltd since last Thursday, a company official said on Wednesday.

"We have not shut the factory. The workers are not working since last Thursday, after demanding a cost of living allowance, which the company does not pay," said a senior company official who declined to be named.
Kelani Tyre, privatised in March 1992, has in the past offered a package of incentives which did not include a cost of living allowance, he told Reuters.
The dispute, which mainly involves the company's 900-strong production work force, has been referred to the Labour Commissioner, the official said.
Kelani Tyre has a 40 percent share of the local market for tyres.
The shares last traded on Tuesday at 6.50 rupees.
